Burma: Burmese armies sack Ayutthaya; end of Ayutthaya Kingdom
Chile: The Spanish empire exiles all Jesuits. Ancud is founded. Chiloé becomes part of the Viceroyalty of Peru.
India: First Anglo-Mysore War begins, in which Haidar Ali of Mysore defeats the combined armies of the East India Company, the Marathas and the Nizam of Hyderabad.
Mexico: The Society of Jesus was expelled from New Spain.
Russia: Repnin Sejm: Four Polish senators who opposed the policies of the Russian ambassador Nicholas Repnin were arrested by Russian troops and imprisoned in Kaluga.
USA: The Townshend Acts, named for Chancellor of the Exchequer Charles Townshend, were passed by Parliament, placing duties on many items imported into America.
